availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James M. Ragland (Bath County, Kentucky, farmer.)

body.p: Bath County, Kentucky, farmer. Virginia native. Married to Lucinda Mockbee Ragland in Bath County, Kentucky on November 5, 1828. Father of Cordelia Ragland, James R. Ragland, John W. Ragland, and Thomas Ragland. Farmer in Bath County in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Bath County 1850. Farmer in Bath County in 1860. Employed George Hiley as a farm hand in 1860. Owned two enslaved persons in Bath County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath, Division 2, p. 19A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath, Division 2, p. 304.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Bath, Owingsville, p. 45.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Bath, p. 79B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Bath County Marriages, Film #000273003.
